page.title: 11RECREATION, HAYDON BRIDGE
page.content: The majority of our farmers & their families hunt, or ride horses for pleasure. We are part of the Haydon Hunt country which harbours many foxes.{Fishing}is popular. Some is in private hands but permits and licences can be obtained in the village for salmon, trout & coarse fishing.{Game & {vermin shooting}is in private hands but poachers do exist.{Cricket}is popular. The Haydon Bridge C.C. uses the High School's ground & plays in West Tyne leagues. It has several disconcerting bowlers & batsmen who are difficult to get out. Many of our young people join the Haydon Bridge Football club, or Scouts, Guides, Cubs & Brownies. All are welcome to play Squash at the High School Sports Centre & the School Hall is used for Plays, Dances & Concerts.
